intro: Juglans major var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth walnut, is a variant of the Persian walnut native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless bark and large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a thick, green husk that splits open when mature. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in dry, warm climates. This variety is valued for its nut quality and has been cultivated for both ornamental and agricultural purposes.
